remarks: FlexiHUD is the mod's name, do not localize
A simple On/Off toggle that allows to completely disable the whole HUD
An option that lets you specify a custom key that will toggle the HUD on and off
Title for the general options

Submenu in the main menu that is simply a collection of visibility options for every HUD block. Lets the user quickly toggle specific blocks on/off without having to enter each block's specific submenu.

Submenu in the main menu that only contains a list of options that control visibility of all elements. This lets the user quickly toggle elements on/off without having to open each element's individual menu.
Subtitle in the "Apperance..." submenu. Followed by a few options related to the HUD's background.
This fields lets the user input the name of a custom font to be used in the HUD
This fields lets the user input the name of a custom font to be used in the HUD
This fields lets the user input the name of a custom font to be used in the HUD
Generic term. A slider that controls the scale of the HUD.

General setting under the "Apperance and scaling options" menu. This determines how the individual offsets for each element work. If this is enabled, the offsets will become absolute values, ignoring current UI scaling settings. This is preferable for more precise positioning of HUD elements.

default:
If enabled, offsets applied to the elements ignore
current resolution and UI scale.
remarks: Description of the above option. Keep under 2 lines.
ru:
Если включить этоу настройку, положение смещенных
элементов не будет зависить от масштаба интерфейса.

remarks: This is a slider that controls the base scale value of the HUD; all individual elements can also be scaled relative to this one.
If enabled, FlexiHUD's base scale will follow GZDoom's built-in HUD scale settings.
This is just a shortcut that opens GZDoom's built-in "HUD" menu.
pt: Opções de escala de HUD do GZDoom

remarks: General appearance of the background: either a flat color or a texture
Option for background appearance
Option for background appearance
General background color
General background opacity
If the background mode is set to "Texture", this option will let the player input the name of the texture

default:
Enter the name of the desired texture here. It has to be
a texture that actually exists in the current game/mod.

Keep under 3 lines
Use physical linebreaks (alt-Enter)

Insira o nome da textura aqui. Precisa ser uma
 textura que exista no jogo ou mod.

Trage den Namen der gewünschten Textur ein.
Die Textur muss im derzeitigen Spiel/Mod existieren.

Escribe el nombre de la textura. La textura
debe existir en el juego o mod actual.
fr:
Entrer le nom de la texture désirée ici. Cela doit être une

Option for "Texture fit mode"

default: Reset ALL FlexiHUD settings to default

Generic option name. Used in any element that has numbers (e.g. inventory bar, weapon slots). This option lets you adjust the color of those numbers.
Generic option name. Used in any element that supports differnet alignment options, mainly horizontal and vertical (for example, weapon slots, powerups, inventory bar).
Alignment option for things like weapon slots, powerup icons, and inventory bar
Alignment option (vertical - top to bottom)

Title for the damage display settings

This lets the player change the multiplier for the classic red screen tint when they take damage. If they prefer to only rely on damage markers as a damage indicator, they may choose to reduce this to 0.

pt: Multiplicador do tinto de dano na tela
fr: Multiplicateur de rougissement de l'écran classique

remarks: Directional damage markers are shown on the HUD, pointing to the enemy that just attacked the player
A 0.0-1.0 slider. When a new damage marker appears, it uses this opacity value; then it fades out to zero.
pt: Opacidade máxima dos marcadores de dano
fr: Opacité maximale du marqueur de dégâts

remarks: The time in seconds it takes a damage marker to completely fade out after appearing.
pt: Tempo de desvanecimento dos marcadores de dano (segundos)
fr: Temps d'évanouissement du marqueur de dommage (secondes)

remarks: Title for the submenu that controls the health/armor HUD element.
Whether and how the health/armor element is displayed. Possible options: Off, Numbers, Bars.
pt: Exibir barras de vida e armadura

remarks: Option for how health/armor is displayed: numbers or bars
Option for how health/armor is displayed: numbers or bars
Option that controls what is displayed next to the armor numbers: the armor's icon, its absorption percentage, or both (icon below, percentage on top)
pt: Exibição do valor e ícone da armadura

remarks: Option for Armor icon/absorption display
Option for Armor icon/absorption display
pt: Apenas o valor em por cento

remarks: Option for Armor icon/absorption display
pt: Ícone e valor em por cento

remarks: Title for a submenu with health/armor color settings. Located under "Health and armor display" menu
pt: Opções de cores da vida e armadura

remarks: Subtitle for Health and armor color settings menu
Subtitle for Health and armor color settings menu

This option allows adjusting the rules by which the Armor colors and Health colors are colorized. The options for Armor and Health are separate but their names are identical (they're just positioned in different sections).
Option for "What color reflects". This one is only for Armor: color reflects the damage absorption of the current armor.
Option for "What color reflects": color changes based on the remaining amount of Armor/Health
Option for "What color reflects": one fixed color
This appears is "What color reflects" is set to Nothing (always single color)
Sub-title above color selectors

Element in the section for health and armor numbers. This element allows the user to modify how manu color ranges their health/armor numbers will have (for example, they can choose 2 ranges to only cover 0-25% and 25-200%, or 4 ranges for 0-25%, 26-50%, 51-75%, 76-200%, or more). Specifically, this determines the number of ranges displayed in the complex custom menu element that allows them to set this up.

Element in the section for health and armor numbers. Possible values: "Flat colors" or "Gradients". This lets the user decide if their health/armor bars/numbers will change their colors gradually or instantly when approaching certain values.

Option for "Color mode", in reference to health/armor numbers/bars colorization mode. This option means that the color of the numbers/bars will change immediately when entering a specific range.
This can also be translated as "fixed colors". Basically, this means that the colors will change from one fixed color to another, not using gradients.

Option for "Color mode", in reference to health/armor numbers/bars colorization mode. This option means that the color of the numbers/bars will change gradually as the value moves between the user-defined ranges.
NO LONGER USED
NO LONGER USED
NO LONGER USED
NO LONGER USED
NO LONGER USED
NO LONGER USED
NO LONGER USED
NO LONGER USED
NO LONGER USED
NO LONGER USED

Title of the submenu with mugshot settings
Can also be translated as "protagonist's face" and similar

Name for the option that controls how the mugshot is displayed. Possible options:
off, left of health/armor display, right of health/armor display, independent
The mugshot is attached to the left side of the health/armor element
The mugshot is attached to the right side of the health/armor element
The mugshot is positioned independently, as its own element
Title of the submenu that controls the element with the currently selected weapon's icon and its ammo information.
Whether current ammo is displayed. Possible values: On, Off.
Whether selected weapon icon is displayed (On/Off)

Whether a gauge for the ammo is displayed (On/Off). If set to OFF, only the number will be shown.

This string was updated so that "bars" is now PLURAL.
fr: Affichage de la barre de munitions

remarks: Title for the submenu that controls the display of all ammo possessed by the player.
Whether to display a separate block with all ammo currently in the player's inventory. Options: Off, For the weapons you have, For all weapons in the game
All Ammo block option: only draw ammo icons/amounts for the weapons the player has in their inventory
pt: Para as armas que você tem
fr: Pour les armes que vous avez

default: For all weapons in the game
remarks: All Ammo block options: draw ammo for all weapons that exist in the current game
ru: Для всех видов оружия в игре
pt: Para todas as armas do jogo
fr: Pour toutes les armes du jeu

remarks: Whether to show the ammo you've run out of in the All Ammo block (On/Off)
A numeric option that determines if the All Ammo list is drawn in several columns (default: 1).
The ammo numbers can show either current only, or current/max
Option for "Display format"
Option for "Display format"

Option for the All Ammo block. If enabled, will draw bars behind the numbers.

In English this is a duplicate of $JGPHUD_AMMOBLOCK_SHOWAMMOBAR ("Display ammo bars"), but you can supply a separate translation if this is needed in your language.

Sub-title in the All Ammo block. This opens a section of the menu where you can set up the colors for the ammo bars, by picking the low color and the high color (the bar will automatically pick the color between the two based on the amount of ammo).
The left-side/low ammo color for the ammo bars' gradient
The right-side/high ammo color for the ammo bars' gradient
Title for the menu that controls the display of currently carried keys
Whether to show keys on the HUD. Values: On, Off.
Title for the menu that controls the display of weapon slots.
Whether to show weapon slots on the HUD. Values: Off, Show always, Auto-hide after a delay
Title for the submenu
Whether  to show visible timers (minutes and seconds) for currently active power-ups
Title for the submenu
Whether to show an inventory bar (where applicable, like Heretic, Hexen, Strife)
If this is false, inventory bar will auto-hide after 2 seconds and only the currently selected item will be shown.
pt: Sempre exibir barra de inventário completa
fr: Toujours afficher la barre d'inventaire complète

default:
If inventory bar is always shown, "Use Item" button will
instantly use the item. If not, first press will select the
item, second press will use it.
remarks: Keep under 4 lines! Use real linebreaks (Ctrl-Enter) to add new lines, so that each line is under 60 characters
ru:
Если полоса инвентаря всегда включена, кнопка «Использовать
предмет» сразу использует его. В противном случае первое
нажатие выбирает предмет, а второе использует.
pt:
Se a barra de inventário estiver sempre visível,
o botão "Usar item" funcionará instantaneamente.
Caso contrário, apertar uma vez selecionará
o item, e a segunda vez irá usá-lo.
de:
"Gegenstand aktivieren" aktiviert Gegenstände sofort,
falls die ganze Inventarleiste angezeigt wird.
Falls nicht, werden Gegenstände beim ersten Drücken
ausgewählt und beim zweiten Drücken aktiviert.
esm:
Si la barra de inventario siempre se muestra, "Usar objeto"
usará el objeto de inmediato, de lo contrario, primero se
seleccionará y luego se usará.
fr:
Si la barre d'inventaire est toujours affichée, le bouton
"Utiliser l'objet" utilise instantanément l'objet. Sinon, la première
pression sélectionnera l'objet, la seconde l'utilisera.

default:
Note: Inventory bar will only appear in games/mods
that have items that can be placed in inventory
and used from it.
remarks: Keep under 4 lines! Use real linebreaks (Ctrl-Enter) to add new lines, so that each line is under 60 characters
ru:
Внимание: полоса инвентаря отображается, только если
в игре/моде есть предметы, которые можно использовать
из инвентаря.
pt:
Obs.: a barra de inventário aparece apenas em
jogos/mods que têm itens que podem ser
colocados no inventário e usados a partir dele.
de:
Beachte: Inventarleiste wird nur in Spielen/Mods
angezeigt, in denen Gegenstände vom Inventar aus
aktiviert werden können.
esm:
Nota: la barra solo aparecerá en juegos y mods que
contengan objetos de inventario utilizables.
fr:
Remarque : la barre d'inventaire n'apparaît que dans les
jeux/mods dont les objets peuvent être placés dans
l'inventaire et être utilisés à partir de celui-ci.

remarks:
Inventory bar option that determines how many items you can see at once, effectively determining the max width of the bar.

remarks: Possible value for "Minimap and enemy radar display" option
Possible value for "Minimap and enemy radar display" option
Possible value for "Minimap and enemy radar display" option
A 0.0-1.0 slider that determines the opacity of the minimap/radar background
A slider
Square or circle
A slider for the zoom value

This option toggles generalized map markers that appear on GZDoom's automap if a MapMarker-class actor is placed on it. Vanilla games don't use them, but they may be used in mods and custom projects (e.g. Supplice).
A scale slider for the built-in map markers
General option for the minimap that determines which colors will be used. At 0 uses same colors as the automap, at 1 uses custom colors.
Option for "Minimap/radar color set". If this is set, the minimap will use the same colors as GZDoom's automap.
possible minimap shape
possible minimap shape

Whether to show enemies on the minimap. Possible options: Only alerted enemies / All enemies
This option becomes available when "Minimap and enemy radar display" is set either to "Enemy markers only" or "Minimap and enemy markers"
Option for "Show enemies on the minimap"
Option for "Show enemies on the minimap"
An option to choose the shape of enemy markers. Possible values: Arrow / Dot
Option for "Enemy markers shape"
Option for "Enemy markers shape"

A slider that determines the size of the enemy markers. At 0 (default) the markers are equal to the size of the monster and thus change their visual size according to the minimap's zoom value. At values above 0 they become fixed in size regardless of zoom.

default: Match the size of the object
remarks: The default value for "monster markers size"
fr: Correspondre à la taille de l'objet

remarks:
Determines whether the cardinal direction letters (N, W, E, S) will be displayed on the minimap.
Possible values: Off / Along a circular trajectory / Along the minimap's edge
The cardinal direction letters will always rotate along a circle, even if the minimap is set to use the square shape
The cardinal direction letters will slide along the minimap's edge, either in a circular or square bounding box, depending on the currently used minimap's shape.
pt: Ao redor da borda do minimapa
fr: Le long du bord de la minimap

remarks: A color picker that determines the color of the N W E S letters on the minimap
A slider that determines the size of the cardinal direction letters (N, W, E, S) on the minimap.
A subtitle for a minimap menu section where you control things like "Undiscovered lines opacity" and the colors of the lines
NO LONGER USED
0.0-1.0 slider that determines the translucency of the walls that the player hasn't seen yet.

A slider that changes the size of the block with kill/item/secret counts. The base size is determined by the size of the minimap; this slider lets the player adjust the relative size.
Menu title for showing scoreboard (like the built-in scoreboard, but a small, always visible version)

remarks: When the user chooses "Save current preset", this line appears, followed by a text input field where the user has to enter the name for their current preset.
A button the player presses after they've entered the preset name.
Built-in preset name. This preset only displays the minimap and hides everything else.
Built-in preset name. This preset only displays the directional incoming damage markers and nothing else.

Built-in preset name. This preset only displays the minimap, hitmarkers, incoming damage markers, custom items and an all ammo block, but doesn't display health, current weapon/ammo, weapon slots, or powerup timers.

Built-in preset name. This preset is arranged at the bottom, kinda similar to the classic statusbar. It also uses opaque textured background. Doesn't show the minimap.
Could also be translated similar to "retro", "vanilla-like", "classic look", etc.

Built-in preset name. This is a minimalistic preset that shows no background, no current weapon icon, no minimap; health/armor are displayed as numbers (not bars) and is mostly arranged at the bottom center.

Built-in preset name. This is a bright-green preset where bars around the crosshair are very large (in the style of GoldenEye), and weapon slots are on the right, below the minimap (which is in top right and set to "monster markers only" mode).
